Container.Name: Classifarr
Container.Requires: Requires TMDB API key (free). Optionally requires Ollama for AI classification.
Container.Overview: AI-powered media classification for the *arr ecosystem.[br][br] Automatically routes Overseerr/Jellyseerr requests to the correct Radarr/Sonarr library using AI decision trees and machine learning.[br][br] [b]Key Features:[/b][br] - Single self-contained container with embedded PostgreSQL[br] - Multi-Radarr and Multi-Sonarr support[br] - AI-powered content classification with Ollama[br] - Confidence-based routing with decision trees[br] - Discord notifications with interactive correction buttons[br] - Media server scanning (Plex/Emby/Jellyfin)[br] - Web-based configuration UI[br] - Automatic learning from corrections[br][br] [b]How It Works:[/b][br] 1. Overseerr/Jellyseerr sends webhooks to Classifarr[br] 2. Classifarr classifies content (anime, kids, 4K, etc.)[br] 3. Routes request to the appropriate Radarr/Sonarr library[br] 4. Notifies via Discord with correction options[br][br] [b]Requirements:[/b][br] - TMDB API key (free from themoviedb.org)[br] - Ollama instance (optional, for AI classification)[br] - pgvector auto-selects AVX when supported, otherwise uses generic build[br][br] [b]First-Time Setup:[/b][br] 1. Install and start the container[br] 2. Access WebUI at http://[IP]:21324[br] 3. Create admin account in setup wizard[br] 4. Configure TMDB, Radarr/Sonarr, and libraries[br]
Container.Description: AI-powered media classification for the *arr ecosystem. Automatically routes Overseerr/Jellyseerr requests to the correct Radarr/Sonarr library using AI and machine learning.

Config.Name: Web UI Port
Config.Description: Web interface and API port. Access the UI at http://[IP]:[PORT]

Config.Name: App Data
Config.Description: Application data directory. Contains PostgreSQL database, configuration, and logs. DO NOT share with other containers.

Config.Name: PUID
Config.Description: User ID for file permissions. Default 99 is Unraid's 'nobody' user. Change only if you need specific file ownership.

Config.Name: PGID
Config.Description: Group ID for file permissions. Default 100 is Unraid's 'users' group. Change only if you need specific file ownership.

Config.Name: Timezone
Config.Description: Container timezone. Use format like America/New_York, Europe/London, Asia/Tokyo

Config.Name: UMASK
Config.Description: File creation mask. 022 allows owner full access, group/others read. 002 for group write access.

Config.Name: Node Environment
Config.Description: Application environment. Keep as 'production' unless debugging.

Config.Name: Media Path
Config.Description: Path to your media folders. Required for re-classification to verify and move files. Use your Plex/Radarr/Sonarr media root folder (e.g., /mnt/user/media).

Config.Name: Movies Path
Config.Description: Optional: Separate path for movies if not using unified media folder (e.g., /mnt/user/media/movies).

Config.Name: TV Path
Config.Description: Optional: Separate path for TV shows if not using unified media folder (e.g., /mnt/user/media/tv).
